Sentencas: Nickel is the most commonly used anode for solid-oxide fuel cells (SOFC) due to its fast kinetics and low price.
Titulo: Oxidation stages of Ni electrodes in solid oxide fuel cell environments

Sentencas: A leading cause of degradation in Ni electrodes is oxidation.
Titulo: Oxidation stages of Ni electrodes in solid oxide fuel cell environments

Sentencas: Here we use operando ambient-pressure X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) to chemically characterize the Ni electrode of a fuel cell anode during oxidation in a H-2/H2O atmosphere.
Titulo: Oxidation stages of Ni electrodes in solid oxide fuel cell environments

Sentencas: We find three different stages of Ni oxidation in the model SOFC.
Titulo: Oxidation stages of Ni electrodes in solid oxide fuel cell environments

Sentencas: In the first two stages, the Ni exposed to the gas remains metallic but the Ni at the interface with the zirconia electrolyte is oxidized.
Titulo: Oxidation stages of Ni electrodes in solid oxide fuel cell environments

Sentencas: In the third oxidation stage, we find that Ni transforms to NiOOH, a phase not previously considered in the SOFC literature.
Titulo: Oxidation stages of Ni electrodes in solid oxide fuel cell environments

Sentencas: We show that the transformation between Ni and NiOOH is reversible and is initiated at the Ni/gas interface.
Titulo: Oxidation stages of Ni electrodes in solid oxide fuel cell environments

Sentencas: In addition we find that NiOOH stores charge, as evidenced by the stable discharge plateau (voltage) measured as this oxyhydroxide phase reduces to metallic Ni.
Titulo: Oxidation stages of Ni electrodes in solid oxide fuel cell environments
